basic.description: This course provides an historical overview of theories of leadership within educational institutions and an evolution of the practices of leadership. Participants will examine the social and cultural construction of leadership, will gain an understanding of the range of roles and responsibilities that a leader has within an organization; will apply effectively selected leadership skills and processes; and will develop conceptual frameworks to understand behaviours within the organization. Various theories of the attributes of a leader (e.g., trait, transformational, distributive, inclusive) are explored. Not offered 2010-2011.
basic.subject: EDUC
basic.title: Educational Leadership
